verses.name: Psalms 77:1
verses.text: I cried unto God with my voice, even unto God with my voice; and he gave ear unto me.

verses.name: Psalms 77:2
verses.text: In the day of my trouble I sought the Lord: my sore ran in the night, and ceased not: my soul refused to be comforted.

verses.name: Psalms 77:3
verses.text: I remembered God, and was troubled: I complained, and my spirit was overwhelmed. Selah.

verses.name: Psalms 77:4
verses.text: Thou holdest mine eyes waking: I am so troubled that I cannot speak.

verses.name: Psalms 77:5
verses.text: I have considered the days of old, the years of ancient times.

verses.name: Psalms 77:6
verses.text: I call to remembrance my song in the night: I commune with mine own heart: and my spirit made diligent search.

verses.name: Psalms 77:7
verses.text: Will the Lord cast off for ever? and will he be favourable no more?

verses.name: Psalms 77:8
verses.text: Is his mercy clean gone for ever? doth his promise fail for evermore?

verses.name: Psalms 77:9
verses.text: Hath God forgotten to be gracious? hath he in anger shut up his tender mercies? Selah.

verses.name: Psalms 77:10
verses.text: And I said, This is my infirmity: but I will remember the years of the right hand of the most High.

verses.name: Psalms 77:11
verses.text: I will remember the works of the Lord: surely I will remember thy wonders of old.

verses.name: Psalms 77:12
verses.text: I will meditate also of all thy work, and talk of thy doings.

verses.name: Psalms 77:13
verses.text: Thy way, O God, is in the sanctuary: who is so great a God as our God?

verses.name: Psalms 77:14
verses.text: Thou art the God that doest wonders: thou hast declared thy strength among the people.

verses.name: Psalms 77:15
verses.text: Thou hast with thine arm redeemed thy people, the sons of Jacob and Joseph. Selah.

verses.name: Psalms 77:16
verses.text: The waters saw thee, O God, the waters saw thee; they were afraid: the depths also were troubled.

verses.name: Psalms 77:17
verses.text: The clouds poured out water: the skies sent out a sound: thine arrows also went abroad.

verses.name: Psalms 77:18
verses.text: The voice of thy thunder was in the heaven: the lightnings lightened the world: the earth trembled and shook.

verses.name: Psalms 77:19
verses.text: Thy way is in the sea, and thy path in the great waters, and thy footsteps are not known.

verses.name: Psalms 77:20
verses.text: Thou leddest thy people like a flock by the hand of Moses and Aaron.
